summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2021 discussing technical access issues for an FBI analyst to the 'Epstein SW Database' in Relativity, a legal document review platform. The emails involve FBI personnel and a U.S. Attorney's Office contractor coordinating the setup of RSA token authentication for the database related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: IMI
persons.context: FBI staff operations specialist involved in requesting access to the Epstein SW Database for an FBI analyst, working with the Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force.

persons.name: Shope
persons.context: FBI staff operations specialist who sent an email on December 16, 2020, regarding access to the Epstein SW Database and the need for a physical RSA token.

persons.name: MComey
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who initiated the request for Relativity access for an FBI analyst working on the Epstein case.

connections.description: MComey, an AUSA, requested assistance from IMI, an FBI specialist, to obtain database access for an FBI analyst on the Epstein case.
Both are FBI staff operations specialists involved in the technical coordination for accessing the Epstein investigation database.

events.title: Initial request for Epstein database access
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney MComey requests assistance in obtaining Relativity access for an FBI analyst working on the Epstein case.

events.title: Access form submission
events.description: FBI specialist Shope submits a completed access form for the Epstein SW Database and requests a physical RSA token.

events.title: Token access confusion
events.description: Email chain reveals confusion and technical issues regarding the setup of RSA token authentication for the Epstein database, with the contractor stating tokens are now phone-based.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document references an 'Epstein SW Database' within the Relativity platform, indicating an active investigative database related to the Epstein case as of late 2020/early 2021.
Access to the database required RSA token authentication, with a shift from physical tokens to phone-based tokens causing coordination issues.
The email chain involves multiple agencies: the FBI (including the Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The document shows ongoing investigative activity and evidence management related to the Epstein case more than a year after Epstein's death.
